Purpose and Scope

This document provides a high-level introduction to the Signalcraft AI System, an industrial compressor monitoring platform that uses AI-powered audio analysis to detect equipment anomalies and prevent failures. The system employs a dual-backend architecture with both Node.js (Express) and Python (Flask) servers running simultaneously on a single EC2 instance, orchestrated by Nginx and managed by PM2.

This overview covers:

  • The system's core purpose and capabilities
  • The dual-backend architectural design and rationale
  • Key components and their interactions
  • Technology stack and infrastructure
  • Entry points and request routing

For detailed information about specific subsystems, refer to:

  • Infrastructure deployment and hosting: Infrastructure & Deployment
  • Backend service responsibilities: Backend Services Overview
  • Frontend applications and user interfaces: Frontend Applications
  • AI audio analysis pipeline: AI & Machine Learning
  • CI/CD and operations: Deployment & Operations

System Purpose

Signalcraft is an AI-powered monitoring system designed for industrial compressor equipment, primarily targeting commercial freezer applications. The platform continuously analyzes audio signatures from compressors to detect anomalies before equipment failure occurs, preventing inventory loss and reducing downtime.

Core Capabilities:

CapabilityDescriptionImplementation
AI Audio AnalysisReal-time analysis of compressor audio using ensemble ML modelsensemble_ai_service with MIMII, Random Forest, SVM, MLP models
24/7 MonitoringContinuous sensor data collection and processingsensor_monitoring_service with ESP32 IoT devices
Multi-Channel AlertsNotifications via email, SMS, Kakao messages, and SSEnotification_service and kakao_notification_bp
User ManagementAuthentication with Kakao OAuth and traditional credentialsenhanced_auth_bp and kakaoRoutes
Real-time DashboardLive monitoring interface with WebSocket/SSE updatesrealtime_streaming_service and /api/notifications/stream
Mobile AccessMobile application interface for remote monitoringmobile_app_bp routes

System Architecture Overview

The Signalcraft system implements a dual-backend architecture where Node.js Express and Python Flask servers operate concurrently, each handling different aspects of the application. This design leverages Node.js for I/O-intensive operations (authentication, real-time notifications) and Python for compute-intensive tasks (AI model inference, data analysis).

Dual-Backend Design

Architecture Rationale:

  • Node.js Express (server/app.js1-118) handles authentication, session management, and real-time WebSocket/SSE connections due to its asynchronous I/O efficiency
  • Python Flask (app.py1-184) manages AI model inference, data science workloads, and IoT sensor processing leveraging Python's ML ecosystem
  • Nginx acts as a unified entry point, routing requests based on URL patterns to the appropriate backend
  • PM2 (ecosystem.config.js) provides process lifecycle management, automatic restarts, and log rotation for both applications

Key Components

Client-Side Application

The primary client application is implemented in static/app.js (static/app.js1-833), which manages:

  • Authentication State: updateLoginStatus() (static/app.js30-54) verifies session tokens via /api/auth/verify
  • UI State Management: showLoggedInUI() (static/app.js57-150) and showLoggedOutUI() (static/app.js280-353) dynamically update the interface based on user authentication
  • Kakao OAuth Flow: kakaoLogin() (static/app.js356-383) and handleKakaoCallback() (static/app.js386-405) manage social login
  • Session Storage: Uses localStorage for token persistence (static/app.js31-393)

Server-Side Backends

Express Server (server/app.js1-118):

  • Manages authentication sessions and cookies
  • Handles real-time SSE connections for notifications
  • Routes requests to appropriate handlers via Express Router
  • Serves static assets from static/ directory

Flask Server (app.py1-184):

  • Registers 11+ blueprint modules for modular routing (app.py74-101)
  • Initializes AI services and IoT sensor monitoring on startup (app.py104)
  • Provides backward-compatible API routes for frontend (app.py107-130)
  • Handles CORS preflight requests (app.py64-72)

Service Layer

The service layer implements core business logic independent of HTTP routing:

  • ensemble_ai_service (app.py35): ML ensemble for audio anomaly detection
  • sensor_monitoring_service (app.py40-104): Continuous IoT sensor polling
  • realtime_streaming_service (app.py39): WebSocket data streaming
  • notification_service (app.py40): Multi-channel alert dispatcher
  • firmware_ota_service (app.py41): Over-the-air firmware updates for ESP32 devices

Sources: static/app.js1-833 server/app.js1-118 app.py1-184

curl -s http://localhost:3000

Data Flow Overview

User Authentication Flow

  1. User submits credentials via showLoginModal() (static/app.js521-570)
  2. handleLogin() sends POST to /api/auth/login (static/app.js643-693)
  3. Express authRoutes validates credentials against SQLite (server/routes/authRoutes.js)
  4. Session token stored in localStorage (static/app.js665)
  5. updateLoginStatus() verifies token and updates UI (static/app.js30-54)

AI Diagnosis Flow

  1. User records audio via IntegratedAIDiagnosis class (static/index.html720-1390)
  2. Audio blob sent to /api/lightweight-analyze (app.py127-130)
  3. Flask routes to lightweight_analyze() in ai_routes.py
  4. ensemble_ai_service extracts 200+ features and runs ensemble models
  5. Result returned with confidence score and diagnosis
  6. UI displays results and stores in sessionStorage for history

IoT Sensor Flow

  1. ESP32 devices POST sensor data to /api/esp32/data
  2. Flask esp32_routes receives and validates data
  3. sensor_data_service processes time-series data
  4. Anomalies trigger notification_service
  5. Notifications dispatched via SSE stream (/api/notifications/stream)
  6. Connected clients receive real-time updates

Sources: static/app.js643-693 app.py127-130 server/routes/notificationRoutes.js5-31

Summary

The Signalcraft AI System is a production-grade industrial monitoring platform characterized by:

  • Dual-backend architecture leveraging Node.js for I/O operations and Python for ML workloads
  • Automated CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions deploying to EC2 via SSH
  • Robust process management using PM2 and systemd for high availability
  • Multi-channel notifications supporting SSE, email, SMS, and Kakao messages
  • Real-time AI analysis using ensemble ML models for audio anomaly detection
  • IoT integration with ESP32 microcontrollers for continuous sensor monitoring

The system is hosted at https://signalcraft.kr (EC2: 3.39.124.0) and serves both web and mobile clients with a unified API layer managed by Nginx reverse proxy.
